Package com.redis.foundation.io

Class DataDocConsole

java.lang.Object
com.redis.foundation.io.DataDocConsole
public class DataDocConsole extends Object
The DataDocConsole class provides a convenient way for an application to capture data input from the console. The presentation of the items are aligned based on title name widths. Special handling logic exists to handle password presentations.

Note: Only values that are visible will be processed by this class.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole

  • Method Details

    • setUseTitleFlag

      public void setUseTitleFlag(boolean aTitleFlag)
      By default, the logic will use the title as a prompt string. You can change this default behaviour to use the item name.
      Parameters:
      aTitleFlag - If false, then the item name will be used as a prompt string.

    • setFormattedFlag

      public void setFormattedFlag(boolean aIsFormatted)
      Assign the value formatting flag. If true, then numbers and dates will be generated based on the format mask.
      Parameters:
      aIsFormatted - True or false

    • edit

      public void edit(String aTitle)
      Prompts the user from the console for the bag values.

      Note: This method can only support single value items.

      Parameters:
      aTitle - A title string for the presentation.

    • edit

      public void edit()
      Prompts the user from the console for the bag values.

      Note: This method can only support single value items.

    • writeDoc

      public void writeDoc(PrintWriter aPW, String aTitle)
      Write data document name and values to the console.

      Note: This method can only support single value items.

      Parameters:
      aPW - PrintWriter instance.
      aTitle - A title string for the presentation.

    • write

      public void write(String aTitle)
      Write bag name and values to the console.

      Note: This method can only support single value items.

      Parameters:
